verbs.description: rootle (third-person singular simple present rootles, present participle rootling, simple past and past participle rootled)

entries.meaning: (of an animal) to dig into the ground, with the snout.
examples: Once, presumably, this quadrangle with its smooth lawns, its massive buildings, and the chapel itself was marsh too, where the grasses waved and the swine rootled.

entries.meaning: (of a person) to search for something from a drawer, closet, etc.; to dig out.
